channel.title: KevinCTofel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KevinCTofel.

item.description: We already have dark and light themes on Chromebooks. Next up is adding Android 12‚Äôs Material You for Chrome OS and Chromebooks. https://t.co/BRXwEc18jR

@RyanLounsbury My bad, I thought you were talking about Linux on the Yoga. ü§£ I deleted my response in that regard. As far as Linux on the Duet 3? Basic functionality, sure. As in the occasional use. I wouldn‚Äôt rely on it for a few hours of heavy Linux duty daily.

@RonKJeffries @evanpro I did take this approach, but for different reasons entirely. And I ended up at OMSCS. https://t.co/yP0H5MI8HW It‚Äôs an *excellent* program, however, I decided it wasn‚Äôt for me. https://t.co/GnNx2FslGr
@RyanLounsbury To answer your question: I do, every day on a 2018 CB with Core i5 and 16 GB of RAM. Even with 8 GB it should be very capable.
@svdate America, the land of opportunity where you can become anything!
During IoT Podcast prep: Stacey: "... but we don't understand infinity." Me: "I do. I could explain it to you, but it would take too long." https://t.co/avpUyd8mh1

Given how difficult it can be to get service people to homes and how many people feel disconnected from their stuff, I want to encourage all of you to start with your smart home and embrace DIY. https://t.co/47zpdhs7DR
@AraWagco @stevenmautone @derekmross @tenkely https://t.co/PslVtXcWX5
@tenkely @stevenmautone @AraWagco @derekmross Video output is definitely more capable: https://t.co/gGL3hJUxqB

@tenkely @stevenmautone @AraWagco @derekmross First: Go Lumberjacks! Second, the newer Duet 3 and 5 and pretty solid; not powerhouses by any means but very capable. Third, while there‚Äôs no ‚Äúbest‚Äù CB for everyone, I have my eye on the upcoming Spin 714: https://t.co/O4LDVYBELM
ICYMI: Chrome OS 103 Linux Terminal is prepped for Guest OS installs, aka Bruschetta https://t.co/rQTlNZnG2d https://t.co/M19Eqki2UO
ICYMI: Chrome OS 103 Linux Terminal is prepped for Guest OS installs, aka Bruschetta https://t.co/rQTlNZnG2d
In support of Project Bruschetta, the Chrome OS 103 Linux Terminal is prepped for Guest OS installs on a Chromebook. https://t.co/rQTlNZnG2d

@dominicojames The question is: which ones *don‚Äôt* I use! ü§£ I lean towards CodeSandbox, https://t.co/S1mZj8Jr2Y, and CoderPad (because my current courses use it) to name a few. Personally, I prefer natively coding in Linux on a Chromebook so no cloud needed.
ICYMI: Resizable floating windows coming to Chrome OS tablets https://t.co/yMZ7CD6ZGu https://t.co/MoASB22c8m
ICYMI: Chrome OS tablet mode to get resizable floating windows https://t.co/yMZ7CD6ZGu
Cloud coding for JS exercises on a $299 Chrome OS tablet? Yup! ü§ì https://t.co/Pqctq14eTX
Google is working to bring pinned, floating windows to Chromebooks. Recent code shows that Chrome OS tablets will get resizable windows too. https://t.co/yMZ7CD6ZGu
I just sent the free, weekly About Chromebooks email newsletter to nearly 5,000 subscribers. You can be added to the list by signing up on this week‚Äôs preview page. https://t.co/KGcneJAm5g
@DarrenHumphries Good plan. Just wait for the version with 8GB of RAM as this one has 4. That way you‚Äôll have practically the same performance experience as on your Duet 5. ü§ì
ICYMI: Can you use the Lenovo Duet Chromebook 3 with a monitor? https://t.co/gGL3hJUxqB https://t.co/IUXqZPh8he
Several readers have asked: can you use the Lenovo Duet 3 Chromebook with a monitor? The short answer is yes and it works really well. https://t.co/gGL3hJUxqB
@craigmcginty Interesting! I hadn‚Äôt seen that extension before. I can see how it would benefit some people on Chrome OS. I‚Äôll have to give it a spin. Cheers!
ICYMI: Chrome OS will mimic Windows 11 with Partial Split Chromebook windows https://t.co/RbMwzHA0tZ
Code changes suggest Chrome OS will mimic Windows 11 with Partial Split Chromebook windows: Three equally sized window snaps on your screen. https://t.co/RbMwzHA0tZ
